pull.title: Fixed integer comparison warning.
pull.body: Explicit typecast to remove compiler warning.

events.body: ACK. I don't think nLastBlockFile can be usefully negative, but this is clearly the least risky change.

issue.title: [Block Storage] Always flush block and undo when switching to new file
issue.body:
Fixing a possible blocks db corruption cause.

> Previously, the undo weren't being flushed during a reindex because
fKnown was set to true in FindBlockPos. That is the correct behaviour
for block files as they aren't being touched, but undo files are
touched.

> This changes the behavior to always flush when switching to a new file
(even for block files, though that isn't really necessary).

Coming from #6948.

comments.body: This is obviously the smaller change, but,  couldn't `nLastBlockFile` just be `unsigned`?

I think it could - but that would require having to check whether that breaks anything...and if we're going down that route, we could also start changing a bunch of other variables...and I don't think I want to go down that path right now :)
